file_content.text: The scans of Sobrik are coming in clear as crystal. You did a fine job, Captain.
The jammers have been destroyed, Major. I repeat, the jammers are down.
That's good to hear, Captain. I was starting to sweat.
All right, the aerial scans are coming in now... let's see if we can find that Weequay. Hmm.
I'm seeing signs of an explosive entry at the Imperial HQ, near the administrative offices. We don't have any people in the area, so it's got to be Vik's handiwork.
I'll proceed to the area immediately.
Copy that.
Why would Vik attack Imperial headquarters?
What's he doing there?
Your guess is as good as mine. Somehow I doubt it's as heroic as it sounds.
If Vik isn't where you say he is, I'm going to be very unhappy, Major.
You'd better be right.
Save your "scary" face for the enemy, Captain. I'm a busy man.
I'm sending you the coordinates now. When you run into Vik, pass on my thanks for all his help. Triam out.
Get those jammers down ASAP.
Captain. I'm Major Triam, Thirty-fifth Recon. You can stand at ease.
I appreciate your time, Major. I'm hoping you can help me find a Weequay named Tanno Vik.
Thank you.
I'll bet I can.
I'm looking for a Weequay named Tanno Vik. Have you seen him?
Let's get down to business.
Yeah. I've seen him.
Get me everyone you have, Triam--I want a wide-area search for a Weequay named Tanno Vik.
Make yourself useful.
I said you could stand at ease, not bark orders at a superior officer. You're lucky I want to find Vik, too.
That lying filth "volunteered" to destroy some Imperial jammers in Sobrik. They're blocking the scan data from all of our high-altitude probe droids.
Vik took the explosives, but never did the job. The resistance needs the data from those probes to avoid patrols and conduct raids.
Just give me the target coordinates, and I'll move out.
I can disable the jammers.
It's not that simple, unfortunately.
Where'd he go with the explosives?
What happened to Vik?
Don't know, but once the data from the probes is flowing again, we can track him down in an instant.
I'm getting sick of cleaning up Vik's messes.
Not again!
Aiding the resistance is a priority objective--we've got no choice.
You'll need detonite charges to bring the jammers down. Vik took the last of mine, so you'll have to do a bit of scrounging.
The Imps have checkpoints scattered through Sobrik--they'll have explosives. Once you have enough charges, hit those jammers hard.
Consider the jammers scrap, sir.
Understood.
Be sure the resistance knows who helped them.
As long as I get credit.
I'm sure your name will come up in the after-action reports.
Don't you have personnel that could deal with the cannon, Major?
Can't you do this?
We're a recon team, not commandos. It's you or it's nobody.
Slow down, Major. I already have a mission.
I never said I'd help.
You'll do what I order you to, Captain. It will work out better for you in the end anyway.
Once the jammers are down and we start getting full aerial scans of Sobrik, we can pinpoint exactly where Vik took my explosives.
Contact me via holo as soon as the jammers are down. Dismissed, Captain.
